{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3302742,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:07:52.269Z","cooked":"

I have an intake sub system. When the arm of my robot is in the home position, I want the intake to go to the stow position, assuming I’m not pursuing an intake specific command like “intake note”.

I thought this would be an appropriate place to use a default command. However, the Java docs are fairly unclear as to how I set that up. Can someone explain it a little more clearly?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-06T03:07:52.269Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":152,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":773.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":453532,"topic_slug":"java-default-command","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/java-default-command/453532/1","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3302743,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:08:19.614Z","cooked":"

Call setDefaultCommand on the subsystem. That’s it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-06T03:08:19.614Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":18.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":453532,"topic_slug":"java-default-command","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/java-default-command/453532/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3302746,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:12:12.501Z","cooked":"

Where do I call it from? What do I need in the subsystem? Where do I place the code I want run as default?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-06T03:12:12.501Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":22.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":453532,"topic_slug":"java-default-command","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/java-default-command/453532/3","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3302747,"name":"Jessie Adkins","username":"Zaheelee","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:12:34.357Z","cooked":"

In this case, you might be better suited to have your “arm to home position” command also invoke the “intake to stow position” command.

A Default Command is the thing that runs when there are no other active commands. It’s great for things like drivetrains, where you typically want joystick/controller commands running any time you are not doing a special task. However, for something like an arm, you may not want the intake to always return to a “stow” position after every attempt to run a command that sets it to a specific angle.

However, if that is actually what you want, then Oblarg is right, you just call setDefaultCommand in your initialization code

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-06T03:12:34.357Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":453532,"topic_slug":"java-default-command","display_username":"Jessie Adkins","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62391,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 8032 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/java-default-command/453532/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 8032 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3302750,"name":"Jessie Adkins","username":"Zaheelee","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/3e96dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:15:16.176Z","cooked":"

If you want a default command after all, you call it like: subsystemName.setDefaultCommand(CommandName);

That should go in your RobotContainer() constructor,.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-06T03:15:16.176Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":453532,"topic_slug":"java-default-command","display_username":"Jessie Adkins","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62391,"username":"Zaheelee","name":"Jessie Adkins","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/3e96dc/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62391,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 8032 | Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/java-default-command/453532/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 8032 | Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3302752,"name":"","username":"DeltaDizzy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/deltadizzy/{size}/170886_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-06T03:17:04.367Z","cooked":"

To provide some extra clarification, you pass setDefaultCommand any command, be that a command class, a command factory method (in the subsystem or not), etc. You do not really need anything in the subsystem aside from whatever that command uses/needs (and the factory method if you are using one). setDefaultCommand can be called either from an outside class like RobotContainer or from inside the subsystem, depending on preference.
